title.narrative: Capacity Building Support to the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) Towards Protection of Mobile and Vulnerable Populations in the Philippines

description.narrative: The Philippines is one of the most high-risk countries in the world in terms of frequency and intensity of natural hazards such as typhoons, earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, coupled with sporadic and protracted armed conflicts. This results in frequent and complex emergency settings and situations of displacement. The overlapping of manmade and natural disasters, along with a history of protracted displacement and chronic poverty has gradually weakened local government preparedness and response capacities, while communities are pushed from one humanitarian situation to another. As lead of the Emergency Response Cluster, Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) has prioritized the need to ensure disaster-affected communities are provided with assistance in an equitable and targeted manner. To ensure that any progress at the strategic and institutional level is translated into on-the-ground operations, this project contributes towards increased capacity and coordination by the Philippines Government, especially DSWD, to respond to the needs of mobile vulnerable populations, including internally displaced populations through enhanced information management, shelter and emergency response that meet international standards.
